@RedQRedT #wtostc Thanks for a really interesting paper! I've also heard about sphagnum moss being used to treat battlefield wounds, are there any other 'military mosses' that you know of?
@rhona_ramsay @charlottegaga @RedQRedT Thank you! Hope to see you soon!
@rhona_ramsay @charlottegaga @RedQRedT That's fascinating! Would definitely love to know more about the people you mentioned that sold on second hand clothes @rhona_ramsay!

@charlottegaga Thanks for a great fashion and war paper! (Making my heart happy). Q: Aside from stockings, did you see any other garments that were complained about more than others / were particularly in demand? #wtostc
RT @charlottegaga: 4 #WTOStc This was a particularly gendered issue. Women were often responsible for clothing for their entire families, a…

@FWWcartoonPip @BritishCartoonA @UniKentArchives @BBairnsfather Oh interesting - thank you! Lots of interesting parallels of characterisation of propaganda figures in WW2. Mrs Sew-and-Sew, the squanderbug, etc.

@FWWcartoonPip @BritishCartoonA @UniKentArchives @FWWcartoonPip #WTOStc thanks for that fascinating paper! I wondered if there were other instances (like cuthbert) of these characters coming off the page and being used elsewhere - as toys, on posters, other propaganda or souvenirs?
@rhona_ramsay We’re so pleased you could take part. Hope PhD work is going ok!
